references.paper_title: Mastering Atari with discrete world models
references.reason: This paper introduces the DreamerV3 model, which is the basis for the proposed model in this work and a key component of the experiments.
This paper introduces the SAM model, which is a critical component of the proposed method for segmenting images and identifying important features.

references.paper_title: Value gradient weighted model-based reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper introduces the VaGraM method, which is the inspiration for the task-informed image reconstruction with policy-gradient weighting in the proposed model.

references.paper_title: Mastering visual continuous control: Improved data-augmented reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper introduces DrQv2, which is used as a model-free baseline in the experiments.

references.paper_title: The distracting control suite - a challenging benchmark for reinforcement learning from pixels
references.reason: This paper introduces the Distracting Control Suite, a benchmark used for evaluating the robustness of model-based reinforcement learning agents to distractions.
